cd:Record.cd:Description: Fields responsible for populating the Fixed Header

cd:Integer.cd:Description: 4 digits used to distinguish between versions of a file having the same validity period

cd:Record.cd:Description: Values responsible for populating the main product header

cd:Text.cd:Description: Software version number of processing software. Format: name of processor (up to 10 char) version number (4 char)

cd:Float.cd:Description: The fraction of particulate backscatter that is detected by the (non-central) pixels of the MSP detector assigned to the "virtual Rayleigh channel" (zero Doppler-shift).
The fraction of particulate backscatter that is detected by the (central) pixels of the MSP detector assigned to the "virtual Mie channel" (zero Doppler-shift).

cd:Array.cd:Description: Pressure grid for the F_Ray and F_Mie look-up table, consisting of N_P = 6 pressure values.
Pressure grid for the F_Ray and F_Mie look-up table, consisting of N_T = 15 pressure values.

cd:Float.cd:Description: The fraction of molecular backscatter that is detected by the (central) pixels of the MSP detector assigned to the "virtual Rayleigh channel" (zero Doppler shift). Array of N_P entries of the look-up table for F_Ray.

The fraction of molecular backscatter that is detected by the (central) pixels of the MSP detector assigned to the "virtual Mie channel" (zero Doppler shift). Array of N_P entries of the look-up table for F_Mie.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Left pixel defininig the Mie virtual channel on the ACCD (not counting the leading 2 pixels)
Right pixel defininig the Mie virtual channel on the ACCD (not counting the leading 2 pixels)
Order of polynomical to use in the Rayleigh signal fitting procedure in the calibration routine

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum altitude to consider [m] for calibration procedure
Maximum altitude to consider [m] for calibration procedure
Minimum scattering ratio to consider for calibration procedure
Maximum scattering ratio to consider for calibration procedure
Number of standard deviations away from the mean to allow when fitting the lidar calibration coefficient with observation.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Minimum number of points required to determine the lidar calibration constants.
Number of wrap around points to use in the fitting procedure.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Fraction of minimum retrieved Clid profiles; below this fraction an additional check is made.
Value by which the Clid polynomial fit is allowed to swing with respect to median beofre a linear fit is used.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If set to 1, then determine EMSR (TOBS replacement) using clear-sky values and apply that instead of the values in the L1b input

cd:Float.cd:Description: Lower limit for tropopause search
Upper limit for tropopause search
Seach window exclusion-zone above trop level for dynamic EMSR determination
Seach window below trop level for dynamic EMSR determination
Minimum altitude for dynamic EMSR determination
Effective R threshold to be used to determine clear-air EMSR

cd:Integer.cd:Description: If set to 1, then apply the in-situ extimated excess noise factor in the noise calculations, if set to 0 then fix excess_noise_factor_per_pixel to 1
If set to one then try to detect and correct for missed Hot Pixels

cd:Float.cd:Description: 1/2 window size to use in hot-pixel line detection
Threhold to use for line detection in HP detection routine
Full-angle receiver effective field-of-view
Full-sngla transmitter divergence
Fill the FM input near the ground: e.g. assume there is always areosol present
If ALE-FM is greather than or equal to this threshold then a feature is assumed to be present
Mie ATB values above this level are assumed to be strong features
R (scattering ratio) values above this level are assumed to be strong features
AEL-FM values at or above this level are assumed to be strong features
If R_profile-sd_R_profile > R_fill_thresh then AEL-FM is adjusted to be max(5,AEL-FM)
If R_profile less than 0 and FM less than FM_Fill_R_Thres, then we assume a strong attenuation adn assume a feature is present.
In simple class if ATB_MIE_profile-sd_ATB_MIE_profile/sd_ATB_MIE_factor then there is at least aerosol there
In simple class R-sd_R > Cld_R_Thresh_Warm then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for T > 0 C)
In simple class R-sd_R > 1.2 then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for T < 0 C)
In simple class R-sd_R > 1.02 then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for stratosphere)
In simple class ATB_MIE_profile > cld_ATB_Thresh_Warm then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for T > 0 C)
In simple class ATB_MIE_profile > Cld_ATB_Thresh_Cold then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for T < 0 C)
In simple class ATB_MIE_profile > Cld_ATB_Thresh_Strat then there may be a cloud of some sort (applicable for stratosphere)
Stratospheric clouds with lower temperatures than this are assumed to be type 1 PSCs.
Stratospheric clouds with lower temperatures than this are assumed to be type 2 PSCs.
In simple class R-sd_R > water_cld_R_thresh then there is a water cloud for sure
In simple class ATB_MIE_profile > wa-ter_cld_ATB_thresh then there is a water cloud
Ad-Hoc multiplicative adjustment of lidar calibration constant
A priori value of water cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of water S
A priori value of water S relative uncertainity
A priori value of water effective area radius
A priori value of water Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for water
A priori value of ice cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of ice S
A priori value of ice S relative uncertainity
A priori value of ice effective area radius
A priori value of ice Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for ice
A priori value of ice cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of ice S
A priori value of ice S relative uncertainity
A priori value of ice effective area radius
A priori value of ice Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for aerosol
A priori value of ice cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of ice S
A priori value of ice S relative uncertainity
A priori value of ice effective area radius
A priori value of ice Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for aerosol
A priori value of ice cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of ice S
A priori value of ice S relative uncertainity
A priori value of ice effective area radius
A priori value of ice Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for aerosol
A priori value of ice cld depol (due to MS)
A priori value of ice S
A priori value of ice S relative uncertainity
A priori value of ice effective area radius
A priori value of ice Ra relative uncertainity
Fixed value of eta for aerosol
Maximum allows step side in line minimization search step
Check for convergence on zero gradient
Check for convergence on successive iterations
Maximum number of iterations
If Chisq/dof resulting from the OE inversion is greater than this threshold, then the corresponding QA bit is set
Lower height for which the mean noise level in the channel is calculated.
Upper height for which the mean noise level in the channel is calculated.
Pulse repeat frequency of ALADIN.
The value for which the Mie signals have to be above the noise to detect surface.
Velocity of the ADM satellite.
Maximum size of the gap allowed for which the atmospheric statistics does not change (~60 km).
Maximum difference between Lidar surface and DEM information allowed.
Fraction of the 4 pixels above surface to assign as additional surface peak.
The minimum ratio between the first (s1) to second (s2) pixel required to set s1 as surface.
The maximum ratio between the surface signal (s0) and the first pixel (s1) to set s1 as surface.
Minimum probability value accepted by hybrid median masking.
Maximum Rayleigh probability value accepted by hybrid median masking (between 0 and 100).
Minimum trace amount of aerosols Mie backscatter in the atmosphere
Width to be filled in with a 5 between the surface and lowest aerosol detected pixel
Minimum probability for which the pixel is always assigned as feature.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of iterations performed with the hybrid median algorithm.
Width of the hybrid median window.
Number of histogram data points.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum histogram value.

cd:Array.cd:Description: Ratio for which signal has to exceed the gaussian fit to be qualified as feature.
Size in pixels of the convolution kernel (x,z) used.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Gaussian width of the convolution kernel (x,z) used in the procedure (sig=value/alog(8)).

cd:Array.cd:Description: Defines the iteration steps after which the convolution results are checked for gaussian fit.
Maximum value of the featuremask assigned per convolution (negative=full stat.)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of iterations for convolution.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Factor for surface noise probability.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Value given to the lowest bin to increase chance of finding surface values.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Laser wavelength.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Altitude up to which AMD profiles are calculated.
Altitude down to which AMD profiles are calculated.
Vertical resolution of the calculation of AMD profiles.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Multiplicative factor in the formula to get the molecular backscatter coefficient from atmospheric data.
Reference wavelength in the formula to get the molecular backscatter coefficient from atmospheric data.
Exponent of the ratio of wavelengths in the formula to get the molecular backscatter coefficient from atmospheric data.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Reference pressure in the formula to get the molecular backscatter coefficient from atmospheric data.
Reference temperature in the formula to get the molecular backscatter coefficient from atmospheric data
Threshold lesser than which the delay between a measurement and an AMD profile must be.
Threshold on the Mie SNR to consider the Mie signal as valid
Threshold on the Rayleigh SNR to consider the Rayleigh signal as valid
Threshold on the Mie SNR defined on middle bins to consider the Mie signal as valid
Threshold on the Rayleigh SNR defined on middle bins to consider the Rayleigh signal as valid
Threshold on the relative error of particle backscatter retrieval (ratio of the variance of the particle backscatter coefficient to the particle backscatter coefficient)
Threshold on the relative error of particle extinction retrieval (ratio of the variance of the particle extinction coefficient to the particle extinction coefficient)

Threshold on the relative error of particle backscatter retrieval on middle bins (ratio of the variance of the particle backscatter coefficient to the particle backscatter coefficient defined on middle bins)

Threshold on the relative error of particle extinction retrieval on middle bins (ratio of the variance of the particle extinction coefficient to the particle extinction coefficient defined on middle bins)
Threshold above which we consider that the backscattered signal was totally attenuated by absorption.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Above this value, the BER retrieval is supposed to be invalid
Below this value, the BER retrieval is supposed to be invalid

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Threshold lesser than which the gap between a Rayleigh bin border and a Mie bin border must be for them to match.

If set to `0`, no radiometric correction is performed. If set to `1` radiometric correction type 1 (individual correction per BRC) is performed, if set to 2, radiometric correction type 2 (temperature M1 fit correction) is performed.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Minimum signal level for observed signal to be used for the radiometric correction.
SR threshold for selection of aerosol free bins within the height regime specified by Lower_Height and Upper_Height.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Lower boundary of height regime for signals used for radiometric correction.
Upper boundary of height regime for signals used for radiometric correction.
2*Filter_Size + 1 is used as the window size for the median filter applied to energy corrected Kray/Kmie derived from aerosol free bins on BRC level.
Minimum number of valid BRC required to perform the Radiometric Correction type 2.
Switch for denoising algorithm. If set to 1, the algorithm is run, 0 otherwise.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Tolerance parameter for controlling the L-BFGS convergence
Maximum number of L-BFGS iterations
Scaling factor for physical regularization
Initial lidar ratio value for physical regularization
Lower lidar ratio limit for physical regularization
Upper lidar ratio limit for physical regularization
Lower lidar ratio limit for error estimation
Upper lidar ratio limit for error estimation

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Switch to error calculation from Poisson noise hypothesis if set to 1
Subdiviser term to get number of profiles per BRC to be optimized by the MLEsub.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Min value of Mie SNR to be used for validity check (QC flag).
Min value of Rayleigh SNR to be used for validity check (QC flag).
Max value of backscatter for particles error estimation to be used for validity check (QC flag).
Max value of extinction for particles error estimation to be used for validity check (QC flag).
Lidar ratio value for cloud backscatter derivation from total cloud extinction
Backscatter threshold for cloud mask (i.e. value from which the bins are flagged cloud contaminated)
SNR threshold used in median filter.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Width given as number of measurements used to smooth SNR values.
Minimum number of measurements needed to form a group.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Transmission threshold used in median filter.
Particulate backscatter coefficient value below which the first matching bin will be considered empty of any particle, introducing thus no oscillating bias in the extinction retrieval.

Particulate backscatter coefficient value below which the coefficient and its derivatives will be considered invalid and set to -1. Slightly ngative values may be accepted to catch a glimps of the oscillations around zero.
SLOD value below which the coefficient and its derivatives will be considered invalid and set to -1. Slightly ngative values may be accepted to catch a glimps of the oscillations around zero.

Particulate backscatter coefficient value below which thecoefficient and its derivatives will be considered invalid and set to - 1. Slightly ngative values may be accepted to catch a glimps of the oscillations around zero.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Maximum number of iterations in the iterative estimation of the SLOD.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Maximum gap between the ratio of the normalized two way transmission and the squared transmission from the satellite to the bin and the value resulting of the SLOD estimation.
Coefficient involved in the determination of the asymptotic expansion to be used in the inversion to get the SLOD. It's value is set to 0.4 and may be static.

Value below which the SR_fine frim L1B data is considered not vali. Note that the default value of 0.75 will obviously lead to quantitatively wrong results, but the shape of the variations may be ept in the calculation thus enabling some interpretation.
Value of the SR above which the presence of a cloud is strongly assumed.
Value of the BER below which the presence of a cloud is strongly assumed.
Set to 273.15 K for 1 bar pressure.
Temperature down to which supercooled water may be seen in the atmosphere. Set to 233.15 K.
RH value above which the presence of a cloud is strongly assumed. Taking the incertitude of the model, it is set to 0.94.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Flag indicating if simulated or measurement AISP data was used to process up to Level 1B

cd:Float.cd:Description: Seed value for random number generation used in high resolution ATB calculation.
Error reduce factor used during calculation of high resolution data.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Currently set to 0, which in turn flags all AEL-PRO results invalid (flag Overall_Quality in the AEL_PRO_PCD_ADS set to 0). As soon as the prototype team has validated the operational L2A results, this flag will be set to 1, and AEL-PRO results are flagged valid.
